<@U0K8ZSHN0> and <@U0HPGQ4KH> we have two meetings oon the books: tomorrow was supposed to be time for lee and i to respond to felix’s first stab but we cleared that today.  <@U0HPGQ4KH> you ready to review another iteration tomorrow or should we save that for friday?  want to get you work time but dont want you spending too much time without checking in

i moved to tomorrow afternoon to allow more qork time.  remember work with lee as you go.  

In addition the parameters we discussed before, let’s also start to give consideration towards:
Fumes, Smell, Space to operate.  Accordingly, Josh (Chewy) took a look and lent the following insights:
- chop saw needs 8+ feet to left and 4+ feet to right. maybe need (2), one dedicated to non-ferrous metal
- sand blasting cabinet typically opens at left and right. noisy and potentially dusty
- robotic arm needs to be fenced off. should be near what it's being used for.
Zach's has giant drive box. more useful with 8th axis rail
- waterjet is noisy: 75dB below water and 95dB above. potential spray. need lost of access on 3 sides to load material (metal sheet weighing hundreds of pounds) 
- press brake needs lots of room at front and rear
- wire EDM machine noisy and produces fumes. should be away from EE stuff
Those are all great suggestions, felix and I discussed maybe having a dirty floor and a clean floor
I didnt get a chance to work on adding equipment but I will review that tomorrow morning
